comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0b9pre) Gecko/20110104 Firefox/4.0b9pre
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0b9pre) Gecko/20110104 Firefox/4.0b9pre

After downloading a file has completed the notification slider with the link "All files have finished downloading" doesn't appear in the right corner.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start a file download from a website (e.g a zip file from http://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/firefox/nightly/latest-trunk/)
2. Wait until the file is completely downloaded.

Actual Results:  
No "Downloads complete" notification.

Expected Results:  
You should get a "Downloads Complete" notification slider in the lower right of your screen.

Not reproducible on Win 7 and Win XP.
comments.creator: andreea.pod@softvision.ro
comments.author: andreea.pod@softvision.ro

comments.raw_text:
Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.7; rv:17.0) Gecko/17.0 Firefox/17.0

This issue is also reproducible on Mac OS X 10.7 - the 'Downloads Complete' notification is not displayed in the lower right side of the screen.
comments.text:
Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.7; rv:17.0) Gecko/17.0 Firefox/17.0

This issue is also reproducible on Mac OS X 10.7 - the 'Downloads Complete' notification is not displayed in the lower right side of the screen.

Still no changes - no message about download completing.
(Firefox 15 @ OS X 10.7.4)
comments.author: noteboox@yandex.ru
